page.title: 03FARMING 2
page.content: { Moorland ponies,}owned by farmers with commoners' rights grazed on rough pasture. They were not true moorland ponies but were hybrids. At Huckworthy Lodge on the other side of the valley, there was a {riding stable,}with a special paddock for teaching novices. {FENCING } Boundary fences were mainly to be found on the higher land.These consisted mainly of a base of dry stone walling with strands of wire above,with the top strand barbed.The {stone walling}was sometimes newly repaired but not fixed with mortar. At the entrances to some fields were timber sheep{pens,}recently constructed, designed not only for normal sheep penning,but also for easy collection and delivery from market. Hedging found lower down the valley.
